p: Plants belonging to the Lamiaceae and Asteraceae families are well known for their high content of polyphenolic compounds, mainly caffeic acid, chicoric acid, cinnamic acid, quercetin, and rosmarinic acid [ 5]. Peppermint ( Mentha piperita), chamomile ( Matricaria chamomilla), and lavender ( Lavandula officinalis) are the most popular herbs due to their positive effect on the digestive system [ 6]. The literature also states that caraway and fennel (Apiaceae) are a rich source of polyphenolic compounds such as caffeic acid derivatives [ 7]. The group of those compounds is characterised by antibacterial, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, antimicrobial, antiviral, and anticancer activities [ 8].
